interestingFact: India is the world's largest democracy.
Egypt is home to the Great Pyramid of Giza, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
The U.S. has no official language at the federal level, though English is the most spoken.
China has the longest continuous civilization, dating back over 3,500 years.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, which produces 20% of the world's oxygen.
Germany is known for its engineering excellence and is the largest economy in Europe.
Australia is home to more than 10,000 beaches.
Tokyo is the most populous metropolitan area in the world.
France is the most visited country in the world, attracting over 89 million tourists annually.
The UK is made up of four countries: England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland.
Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the tallest mountain in the world, standing at 8,848 meters.
